type Visual3D = class inherit DependencyObject interface DUCE.IResource interface IAnimatable

Docs.summary: Provides services and properties that are common to visual 3-D objects, including hit-testing, coordinate transformation, and bounding box calculations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unlike the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> class, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> objects cannot be shared or reused.
Access <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> services by using static methods on the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualTreeHelper> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> objects are optimized to be scene nodes. For example, they cache bounds. Whenever you can, use <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> objects for unique instances of objects within your scene. This usage contrasts with that of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> objects, which are lightweight objects that are optimized to be shared and reused. For example, use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> object to build a model of a car; and use ten <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D> objects to place ten cars in your scene.

Docs.exception: The children collection cannot be modified when a visual children iteration is in progress.

block.para: A class that derives from must call this method to notify the layer that a new child appeared in the children collection. The layer then calls the method.

block.para: To correctly enumerate the visual tree, a class that derives from must override this method and also override the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This transform projects a 3-D point to a 2-D space. The resulting point is the transformed 3-D point in the coordinate space of the specified ancestor.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.TransformToAncestor%2A> method is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

Docs.exception: The specified object is not an ancestor of this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> has no child elements. Therefore, the default implementation always returns 0.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.Visual3DChildrenCount%2A> property is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
